private_information: I am one of two manipulators in the blocks world.
I executed the first part of the action sequence focusing on manipulations of blocks J, I and B (actions 1-8).
agent1.goal: Execute assigned block moves and report the local observations and action log to the orchestrator.

private_information: I am the other manipulator in the blocks world.
I executed the later part of the action sequence focusing on manipulations of blocks B, F, J and I (actions 9-20).
agent2.goal: Execute assigned block moves and report the local observations and action log to the orchestrator.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must integrate their reports into a single consistent global state.
I must produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver that represents the final configuration after the provided action sequence.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' reports and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards representing the final arrangement of all blocks.

public_information: This is a standard Blocks World with the following rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Blocks involved: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J.
Initial arrangement: A is on the table.
Initial arrangement: B is on top of F.
Initial arrangement: C is on top of D.
Initial arrangement: D is on top of H.
Initial arrangement: E is on top of A.
Initial arrangement: F is on top of G.
Initial arrangement: G is on top of E.
Initial arrangement: H is on the table.
Initial arrangement: I is on top of C.
Initial arrangement: J is on top of B.

The agents then execute the following actions in order: 1. unstack(J, B) 2. stack(J, I) 3. unstack(J, I) 4. stack(J, B) 5. unstack(J, B) 6. stack(J, I) 7. unstack(J, I) 8. stack(J, I) 9. unstack(B, F) 10. stack(B, J) 11. unstack(B, J) 12. putdown(B) 13. unstack(J, I) 14. putdown(J) 15. unstack(F, G) 16. stack(F, J) 17. unstack(F, J) 18. stack(F, B) 19. unstack(I, C) 20. stack(I, G).
The task to solve: using the initial configuration and the actions, derive the final arrangement of the blocks and state for each block whether it is on the table or on top of another block.

report.system_prompt: You are an agent operating in the Blocks World. You executed the first subset of the provided action sequence. Produce a concise report describing the actions you executed and the local state changes you observed as a result. Do not produce PDDL; focus on a clear action log and the local perceived stack structure after your actions.
report.prompt: Your name is agent1. You have access to the public information: {environment->public_information} and your private information: {agents->agent1->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->agent1->goal}. Provide a concise report listing the actions you executed, any observations about which blocks became top or were moved, and the local stack relations you observed after your actions. Format the report as plain text that the orchestrator can consume.

report.system_prompt: You are an agent operating in the Blocks World. You executed the later subset of the provided action sequence. Produce a concise report describing the actions you executed and the local state changes you observed as a result. Do not produce PDDL; focus on a clear action log and the local perceived stack structure after your actions.
report.prompt: Your name is agent2. You have access to the public information: {environment->public_information} and your private information: {agents->agent2->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->agent2->goal}. Provide a concise report listing the actions you executed, any observations about which blocks became top or were moved, and the local stack relations you observed after your actions. Format the report as plain text that the orchestrator can consume.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent Blocks World modeling and PDDL for the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the agents' plain-text reports into a single consistent global state. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that captures the final arrangement of blocks after the listed actions. Keep actions executed by different agents distinct in your modeling where relevant. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the PDDL to be compatible with the FastDownwards planner.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive the following public information: {environment->public_information} and the agents' reports: {agent1_report} and {agent2_report}. Your task is to: 1) reconcile the reports into a single final world state, 2) produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem representing that final state as the goal configuration, and 3) ensure the PDDL is compatible with the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Additionally, include a short plain-text summary of the final placement of each block after the actions.
